metadata.title: CVE-2019-17539 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In FFmpeg before 4.2, avcodec_open2 in libavcodec/utils.c allows a NULLpointer dereference and possibly unspecified other impact when there is novalid close function pointer.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17539` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:4.2.1-2
libavcodec-extra - 7:4.2.1-2
libavcodec-extra58 - 7:4.2.1-2
libavcodec58 - 7:4.2.1-2
libavdevice58 - 7:4.2.1-2
libavfilter-extra - 7:4.2.1-2
libavfilter-extra7 - 7:4.2.1-2
libavfilter7 - 7:4.2.1-2
libavformat-extra - 7:4.2.1-2
libavformat-extra58 - 7:4.2.1-2
libavformat58 - 7:4.2.1-2
libavutil56 - 7:4.2.1-2
libpostproc55 - 7:4.2.1-2
libswresample3 - 7:4.2.1-2
libswscale5 - 7:4.2.1-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:4.2.1-2').
